intro: Blepharis edulis var. oblongata, commonly known as the narrowleaf blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a suitable climate.
